cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 385 mi SE of Wilmington, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest and slowing, expected to reach the North Carolina/South Carolina coast late Thursday–Friday, then crawl slowly inland toward South Carolina and Georgia

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of the North Carolina/Virginia border to Cape Charles Light VA, including Chesapeake Bay south of New Point Comfort
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Duck NC to the North Carolina/Virginia border
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Santee River SC northward to Duck NC, with effects extending into the lower Chesapeake Bay and southeastern Virginia
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph gusts) possible at the port late Thursday night through Saturday, with a 34 % chance of sustained 34-kt winds and a 3 % chance of 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 2–4 ft possible along the lower Chesapeake Bay and Virginia Beach area, which could inundate low-lying terminal areas and access roads.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches of rain possible with locally higher amounts; may trigger urban and minor river flooding around the port facilities.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and periods of coastal flooding coinciding with high tide; isolated tornadoes cannot be ruled out in rain bands.
